pageContext.description: Dimensions: EL 89mm; EWbl 23mm; max EBs 14.4mm; EDs 66.2mm,Typology: midrib rounded - poss. little ell. orig. (ie. before dam.); apparently flat circ. s. end,Manufacture: no e. bev. surviving; small perf. poss. cg. flaw.,Condition: bl. e. v. blunt, but no reason to suspect much removed/lost - has rounded section, series of dents along midrib crest - no signs that this is modern -- as also for series of scratches along angles but these cut through soil remains,Attached Material: creamy buff soil in bl. angles and socket.
pageContext.surface: Poss. fragments of thin green patina close to angles; rest flaked to dryer little duller green surface, some speckled light green corrosion pocks.
pageContext.publications: a) Salop Sites & Monuments Record, SA 2599 (see duplicate set)
pageContext.collection: Shrewsbury Museum,acquired via Lily F. Chitty, 1979
pageContext.site: England,Shropshire,Upton Magna,Hunkington Farm,Found in the garden of the farm, 1970 (a)
pageContext.toSearch: Upton Magna, Shrewsbury, Shropshire Sy4, UK
